info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 5 at 5:47PM EDT until August 5 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Gray ME
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of central New Hampshire, including the following county, Sullivan.
* WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 547 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Claremont, Charlestown, Newport, Acworth and Unity.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING
